description: iloc is purely integer-location based; positions are 0-based, not label-based.
quote: Purely integer-location based indexing for selection by position.

description: A single integer row index returns a pandas.Series.
A list or array of integers returns a pandas.DataFrame.
quote: A list or array of integers, e.g. [4, 3, 0].

description: A slice object with ints returns a pandas.DataFrame.
quote: A slice object with ints, e.g. 1:7.

description: A boolean array selects rows where the value is True.
A callable is called with the calling Series or DataFrame; its return value is used for indexing.
quote: A callable function with one argument (the calling Series or DataFrame) and that returns valid output for indexing (one of the above).

description: A tuple of row and column indexes selects both rows and columns simultaneously.
quote: A tuple of row and column indexes. The tuple elements consist of one of the above inputs, e.g. (0, 1).

description: An out-of-bounds integer indexer raises IndexError.
quote: .iloc will raise IndexError if a requested indexer is out-of-bounds

description: Slice indexers allow out-of-bounds indexing without raising IndexError.
quote: except slice indexers which allow out-of-bounds indexing (this conforms with python/numpy slice semantics).

description: Scalar (single row + single column) indexing returns a scalar value, not a Series or DataFrame.
